leukapp.apps.extractions.models module¶

Models and database schemas for the extractions application.

See Django’s Model Documentation for more information.

class Extraction(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: leukapp.apps.core.models.LeukappModel

Aliquot's nucleic acid.

Parameters:
  • aliquot (Aliquot) – The Extraction's parent model.
  • analyte (str) – See ANALYTE for choices.
  • ext_id (str) – ID used extrernally to track the Extraction.
Returns:

Extraction instance.
APP_NAME = 'extractions'¶

Name of the application where Extraction is contained.

aliquot¶

ForeignKey to the Aliquot model.

ext_id = None¶

ID used by the scientist or institution CENTER to track the Extraction. The default value is UNKNOWN.

analyte = None¶

Type of nucleic acid to be sequenced. See ANALYTE for available choices.

workflows_count = None¶

Count of Workflows associated with the Extraction.

int_id = None¶

Internal ID used to describe the Extraction object.

This value is generated by _get_int_id() and it includes crucial information (e.g. D1).

  • D1 indicates that the current Extraction is the first DNA extracted from an Aliquot.
slug = None¶

Extraction's unique identifier (leukid).

The int_id is added to the Aliquot.slug to generate the slug.

_if_new(**kwargs)[source]¶

Executed only when the object is created.

..note:
This method can only be called from save() and is protected by _check_if_caller_is_save().
_if_save()[source]¶

Executed everytime the object is saved.

_get_int_id()[source]¶

Computes the int_id.

The int_id generation is based on a count of Extractions per Aliquot.

Steps:

  • Check if the caller function is _if_new().
  • Retrieve the ID character assigned to the analyte attribute. updates the extractions count, saves the Parent class, and builds the first section of the ID (e.g. D1).
